content.text:
Perfect! I've created a clickable link for the deprecation announcement. The CLI now displays:

1. **Big red deprecation warning** with a red border
2. **Interactive link** - users can press **W** to automatically open https://app.build in their browser
3. **Clear messaging** directing users to the web version

The `WebLinkButton` component:
- Shows "app.build" as an underlined blue link
- Instructs users to "Press W to open"
- Opens https://app.build when W is pressed
- Provides visual feedback with inverse coloring when activated

Users will now see a prominent deprecation notice and can instantly access the web version with a single keypress.

message.content: Can I have a link where I just cmd+click like any regular link?

content.text:
Unfortunately, terminal-based CLIs built with Ink don't support Cmd+Click links like web browsers or modern terminal emulators do. The terminal interface doesn't have the same hyperlink capabilities.

However, I can improve the current solution by making it respond to more intuitive key combinations. Let me update it to also respond to Cmd+Click simulation or make the interaction more obvious:
OK

toolUseResult.text: OK

content.text:
I've updated the component to also respond to the Enter key, which is more intuitive. Unfortunately, true Cmd+Click functionality isn't possible in terminal-based CLIs like this one built with Ink.

The limitations are:
- Terminal CLIs don't have mouse/click event support like web browsers
- Ink (React for CLI) operates in text mode, not GUI mode
- True hyperlinks would require terminal emulator support (like iTerm2's hyperlinks)

The current solution with **W** or **Enter** key presses is the standard approach for terminal applications. This mimics how other CLI tools handle interactive elements.

content.text: You're absolutely right! Many modern terminals support clickable links when they're formatted as proper URLs or using ANSI escape sequences. Let me update this to use a simple URL format that terminals can recognize as clickable:
OK

toolUseResult.text: OK

content.text:
Perfect! I've simplified it to just display the full URL `https://app.build` as an underlined blue link. Most modern terminal emulators (like iTerm2, Terminal.app, VS Code terminal, etc.) will automatically make this Cmd+clickable when they detect the URL format.

This is much cleaner and provides the native clickable experience you wanted without any complex keyboard handling.

content.text:
Perfect! I've made the deprecation notice smaller and more focused by:

1. **Removed the gap** between elements to make it more compact
2. **Removed the redundant bottom line** about CLI support being discontinued 
3. **Added highlight to "DEPRECATED"** using `inverse` styling to make it stand out with a background color
4. **Kept it concise** with just the essential message and the clickable link

The word "DEPRECATED" now has inverse coloring (background highlight) to make it really pop out visually!
